</ce:caption>

</ce:display>
</ce:para><ce:section-title>Supplementary material</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0075" view="all">Supplementary data to this article can be found online at <ce:inter-ref xlink:href="doi:10.1016/j.inoche.2011.11.002" xlink:type="simple">doi:10.1016/j.inoche.2011.11.002</ce:inter-ref>.</ce:para><ce:simple-para id="sp0055" view="all">A mixture of Co(Ac)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·4H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (374<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, 1.50<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol), H<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>PMIDA (136<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, 0.6<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol), H<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>BTC (84<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, 0.4<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol), and 6<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL of H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O was stirred in air for 0.5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h. The resulting solution was heated in a stainless steel reactor with Teflon liner at 100<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C for 2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>days. After a period of approximately 24<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h cooling to room temperature, two kinds of purple crystals with different shapes, cubes and hexagonal prisms, were isolated manually from pink gel, washed with water, and air-dried. Anal. Found (calcd, wt.%) for cubes: C, 19.53(19.47); H, 2.65(2.66); N, 2.71(2.84). IR (KBr, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−<ce:hsp sp="0.10"></ce:hsp>1</ce:sup>): 3437(vs), 1641(s), 1599(m), 1460 (m), 1402(s), 1022(s), 963(m).</ce:simple-para>
clean_text:
Supplementary material

    Supplementary material 1.        Supplementary material 2.     

Supplementary material

Supplementary data to this article can be found online at doi:10.1016/j.inoche.2011.11.002.

A mixture of Co(Ac)2⋅4H2O (374mg, 1.50mmol), H4PMIDA (136mg, 0.6mmol), H3BTC (84mg, 0.4mmol), and 6mL of H2O was stirred in air for 0.5h. The resulting solution was heated in a stainless steel reactor with Teflon liner at 100°C for 2days. After a period of approximately 24h cooling to room temperature, two kinds of purple crystals with different shapes, cubes and hexagonal prisms, were isolated manually from pink gel, washed with water, and air-dried. Anal. Found (calcd, wt.%) for cubes: C, 19.53(19.47); H, 2.65(2.66); N, 2.71(2.84). IR (KBr, cm-1): 3437(vs), 1641(s), 1599(m), 1460 (m), 1402(s), 1022(s), 963(m).
